meanings.definition: A long, narrow strip of material marked with units of measurement for measuring length.
meanings.sent1: I used a tapeline to measure the length of the room.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a tapeline to measure the fabric before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The tapeline decided the winner of the sewing contest.
meanings.sent4: Her tapeline of success was marked by hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The tapeline stretched out like a colorful ribbon of possibilities.

meanings.definition: To measure or mark with a tapeline.
meanings.sent1: She tapelined the dimensions of the box before packing it.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter tapelines each piece of wood before cutting.
meanings.sent3: He tapelined the distance to the finish line with precision.
meanings.sent4: The tapelining process ensured accurate measurements for the project.
meanings.sent5: Tapelining the boundaries helped create a neat and organized garden layout.
